text: [Music]
hi I'm Tamera a customer support team
member here at AWS office in Dublin
today I would like to show you how to
add update or remove alternate contacts
from your AWS account
let's get started by default
AWS sends account related emails to the
email address of the root account user
you can send a copy of these emails to
another email address by creating an
alternate contact there are three
alternate contact types billing
operations and security each email
address receives correspondence related
to their contact type billing the
alternate billing contact will receive
building related notifications such as
when an invoice is available operations
the alternate operations contact will
receive operations related notifications
related to the services running on the
account some service related
notifications such as when an ec2
instance is being retired or requires
maintenance can also be found on your
personal health dashboard security the
alternate security contact will receive
security related notifications such as
abuse reports these will be sent to the
root account as well additional AWS
security related notifications can be
found in the AWS security bulletins RSS
feed to add an alternate contact sign in
to your AWS account as the root user an
open D AWS management console as you can
see I'm already signed in select your
account name and then select my account
on the navigation bar scroll down the
page until you reach the alternate
contact section and then click Edit
input the needed information full name
title email address and a phone number
of the alternate contact you wish to
setup on the account and then click
update
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from always here at EWS
